Debugging the XID 8600 Ethernet interface.

UDP 50731 seems to be status
TCP 50730 seems to be printing


Messages seem to follow a block syntax being multiple of BE 32 bit words.
0: Message type (low bit of first byte is cmd/ack it seems)
1: Length, in number of following 32 bit words
2: Parameter code
3: Sequence
4+: Data

F0000400 00000004 00000004 SSSSSSSS 14000000 1F000000 Some sort of status request
F1000400 00000004 00000000 SSSSSSSS 14020100 1F020100 Response


F0000600 0000000E 00000004 SSSSSSSS 01000000 0A000000 0B000000 0C000000 0D000000 1E000000 1F000000 20000000 21000000 23000000 0E000000 0F000000
F1000600 0000001D 00000000 01060400 00000000 0a020100 0b020131 0c02010a 0d020104 1e060400 00000900 1f060400 00000900 20060400 00003000 21060400  
	  			    00000900 23060400 00000200 0e060202 ee000000 0f222046 43323232 31000000 00000000 00000000 00000000 00000000  
	  			    00000000 00000000 (text is " FC2221)

Print is similar to XID9300.

From printer initial:-
F3000200 0000001C 00000000 SSSSSSSS
Includes printer name and that it is an XID8600

Initial message
F2000300 0000001D 00000002 99999999
And generic document header
F3000400 00000002 00000000 99999999 ACK

F0000100 00000003 00000000 SSSSSSSS 01020000 Command
F1000100 00000002 00000000 SSSSSSSS ACK

01020000 Status check
02020000 Card position check
04028000 Load

Panel...
F0000200 000A7F25 00000000 SSSSSSSS 01000000 0029FC84 0029FC80
